issue.title: [Packaging][deb] Use gem instead of apt to install gobject-introspection gem
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-15569](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-15569). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It seems that `ruby-gobject-introspection` package was removed from Debian GNU/Linux bookwarm:

https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/runs/5062773703?check_suite_focus=true#step:10:1910

```

  + apt install -y -V --no-install-recommends ruby-gobject-introspection
  
  WARNING: apt does not have a stable CLI interface. Use with caution in scripts.
  
  Reading package lists...
  Building dependency tree...
  Reading state information...
  Package ruby-gobject-introspection is not available, but is referred to by another package.
  This may mean that the package is missing, has been obsoleted, or
  is only available from another source
  
  E: Package 'ruby-gobject-introspection' has no installation candidate
```
